name: GHK-Cu (Copper Peptide)
description: A naturally occurring copper-binding tripeptide that declines with age. Extensive research shows it remodels tissue, stimulates collagen and glycosaminoglycans, has anti-inflammatory effects, and may reset gene expression toward a younger pattern.
mechanisms: Stem cell attraction to injury sites
Gene expression reset (resets ~30% of genes to younger pattern)

dosage.notes: Topical for skin/hair. Subcutaneous injection for systemic effects. Naturally present in plasma at ~200ng/ml in youth.

keyFindings: Resets expression of ~30% of human genes toward a younger state (Pickart)
Improved wound healing, skin thickness, and hair growth in clinical studies
interactions: Copper supplements â€” monitor copper levels
